Reviews.Title: “The price was right”
Reviews.Author: Seniorcoupleluvtogo
Reviews.Content: With so many places to stay in Branson, it makes your head spin, but we finally picked Scenic Hills Inn. When I called for reservations the woman I booked the room with asked me, I did not ask, if we'd like a top floor room, in the back that had a nice view. I said that would be great! We arrived on Sunday afternoon and when we went to check in, the check in woman gave me our key, and I asked if it was a room on the top floor on the back of the hotel, like I was told we'd have. She said no, they were sold out the night before, and were still cleaning rooms, and they were not booked very full for Sunday so they were not using the top floor. I objected to that, but to no avail. The room she sent us to was on the middle floor with a fabulous view of the parking lot and street, she asked us to check it out and if we did not like it we could come back down. We did not like it., The "view" is pretty nice out the back, a mix of houses and trees , but still nicer than the parking lot. She said she was not sure what rooms were ready, so we said we could wait, it was not a problem for us, if we could not get in right away we'd just come back later. She checked with housekeepeing, and sent us to check another room. All I looked at was the view, and said we'd take it. We found out later it was a handicap room, so the bathroom was huge, and I hoped no one showed up that needed those facilities. My complaint is that I had to be cranky just to get what we were told we booked. She finally said they do not want unhappy guests, so I do hope they think of that before upsetting another guest. This place is older, no frills, but clean with comfortable beds, and a fair price. The pool area is very nice, too. We did not see any fresh cinnamon rolls the two mornings we were there, but there were some little tins of rolls like you buy at the grocery. We just had breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to hang your hat for a night or two.”
Reviews.Author: lilbigmom
Reviews.Content: Scenic Hills inn was great. The hotel lies on the red line, close to everything, but not on the main strip. I liked this, as it made entering and exiting much easier. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. We had read that the AC was not great, so turned it on high while we were out. Upon return, it was so cold that we had to open the window... and this was on a day when the high was 108. Breakfast was included in our package. The breakfast area offers a simple fare, and is a bit congested due to the way that the serving area is laid out, but with patience, you will not go away hungry. I would stay here again. it is definately a value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhhhhh... its okay.”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBusyMomOfTwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night this past weekend, just so we'd be down in Branson for our kids' swim meet on Saturday morning. An "okay" property, and you can tell at one time in its' prime it was a nice hotel... but it is showing its age. first thing -- should have known something might have been a little off when there was no A/C in the front lobby when we checked in -- and not much A/C in the hallways as we came in the building. Dont know if they were conserving energy, or if this is how it is. Kinda smelled musty as we came in the door to the elevator. Hot elevator, no A/C. Came into our room (has a key, no "key card" by the way)... and it too was musty/damp smelling, not fresh. Sheets were clean, but towels were musty. Had a fridge in the room, but it wasnt on, so we couldnt keep our food we brought cold in it until it got colder -- which was several hours later, so we just kept our food in the ice cooler we brought with us. Nice flat screen TV in the room. Decor was okay, a little dated. A/C unit kept the room cool, but no auto option, so it grinded all night. Walls and floors are thin, so we heard the elephants above us stomping around until midnight, and neighbors next door -- their shower going late, was like it was in our room, not to mention the vent in the bathroom too. I always travel with earplugs, so if you're a light sleeper, you'll need that for the noise around you. Cleanliness -- I really didnt see an issue, but the musty smell was something that turned me off. I found a couple of black hairs at the sink when I went to use it, but threw them in the trash. Toilet was clean, shower was clean. Very SMALL bathroom, but do-able for one night. Only 2 pillows per bed, so if you want additional, bring your own. We checked in at 9:30 p.m., and the front lobby closes at 11pm., so if you need something beyond that, you're out of luck. 2 blankets were in the dresser for covering up if needed. Next morning, we had wanted a great breakfast as the other reviews said there cinnamon rolls, and biscuits and gravy, and waffles............well........ yes there were these things, but the gravy was in little containers you had to heat up. The biscuits were not fresh and fluffy. The cinnamon rolls were up on a tray (plastic box, with doors) like where you'd see bagels/donuts, and were not fresh and warm. Yes there was some cereal and milk. Hard boiled eggs were in the fridge with the gravy in cups. Some fruit juice. And I did not like the coffee at all. Wow, I actually poured it out. Waffles were not freshly made, probably from a box. My kids tried to eat them, and opted not. We wrapped up, and left and went to the nearby grocery store for coffee and breakfast items to eat at the swim meet. All in all, in a pinch we'd probably stay again for maybe ONE night, because it was a reasonable rate and better than another hotel we stayed at recently at the same price point -- but Savannah House is much better in the same area on the Red Route, and has nicer decor and actual hot, freshly made breakfast options. We did not check out the pool, so we cannot review that. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: KBrown0612
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed in the King Jucuzzi Suite for our anniversary and enjoyed it. The room smelled like wet carpet a little but that's understandable because of the large tub. It was how ever very clean. Breakfast cinnamon rolls were good as well as biscuit and gravy. Only thing is that the keys should be updated to cards but we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Muppit
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely good value for the price. The rooms are well cleaned not just supplied with new linens (I saw one of the housekeepers dusting in a room across the hall). The beds only have two pillows on them so if you are with somebody and are like me and sleep with more than one pillow bring an extra; it may be possible to ask for an extra though I didn't try. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. However, the lobby closes at 11 pm and is closed all night. The breakfast was definitely above par for your included continental breakfast; it had fresh homemade cinnamon rolls as well as biscuits and gravy that were personally some of the best I have ever had. The only one negative I have to say about this hotel is that they still use the old fashion metal keys for their rooms instead of the credit card style ones in almost all other hotels. I really didn't like this aspect of the hotel because you are forced to carry around a metal key with a giant plastic keychain on it everywhere you go. There is a 5 dollar lost key fee if you don't keep track of the keys they give you at all times. I also feel like there is an element of security that is lost with the old keys because if somebody before you keeps their key they now have a key to your room (I would be surprised if they change out the locks every time a key goes missing, $5 doesn't seem to be enough to cover that expense). Also, if you lose your keys after 11pm or lock yourself out of your room accidentally there is no way to get into your room as the lobby is closed and locked up and you will have to pay for a night at another hotel unless you can come up with a better solution. If it weren't for this one negative I would have given them 5 stars. All-in-all, I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic Hills - Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wandering57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here the past 2 summers. If you want inside coridoors, but don't want to spend an arm and leg, this is the place for you! It's not the most updated place, but it's comfortable, quiet and clean. Staff are friendly. Lots of parking. Pool is small but nice. I only have one suggestion for management, and that is that they upgrade from room "keys" to electronic key cards, and also put chain locks on the room doors.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: StraitGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend. For the price you can't beat Scenic Hills Inn. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The beds were quite comfortable, and I believe there is a refrigerator in every room. I noticed the bath towels were very soft, unlike other hotels where the towels are like sandpaper. The A/C worked great and it didn't cycle on/off like others, which usually keep me awake by doing so. We really liked this area as well. It's on the Blue Route, so it's easy access to the Tanger Outlet Mall as well as Branson Landing and other attractions. The front desk staff was very friendly. The breakfast items are limited, but enough for smaller appetities. The cinnamon rolls were great! The only problem we encountered were the noisy people in the room above us, but that is certainly not the hotel's fault. I highly recommend this property. Again, it's very clean and has a very reasonable rate. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Rutherford1_12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Scenic Hills Inn in the past and enjoyed every minute there so, we booked reservations for May 2012. This hotel is very clean and nice and quiet. The breakfast includes homemade cinnamon rolls and they are yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yaya182011
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay.The rooms were clean and comfortable.Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: guthriewoman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and have never been dissappointed. Clean and quiet. Great breakfasts! Has a bottom floor to go to during storms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay like always”
Reviews.Author: pomluvers
Reviews.Content: front desk and housekeeping are very friendly,,,,dog friendly also...great location and wonderful breakfast. have been here many times and plan to keep stayong here.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break at Scenic Hills”
Reviews.Author: Monika B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Scenic Hills Inn recently on a family trip. I can't say enough about how happy we were with our stay. To begin with, the service at the front desk was so friendly and went out of their way to help us navigate not only the hotel but also all of the tourist attractions in Branson! Its been some time since I have come across such great customer service. Also throughout our stay everyone seemed so welcoming and helpful! When we walked into our hotel room we were very pleased. Not only was the room super clean and comfortable, there was a plasma screen TV which is really hard to come by in Branson! We loved it! We also ate breakfast at the hotel which was also great! The kids loved the cinnamon rolls and they really liked being able to get their own food. I will also say that I am pretty critical on the coffee at most hotels but the coffee here was fantastic. Finally, the pool was really great to hang out in at night and because it was right by the hot tub, we could still watch the kids and enjoy the tub at the same time! Thank you to all of the staff at the Scenic Hills for making our stay one that we won't forget anytime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: moriverlade
Reviews.Content: Taking a quick drive down and drive back to Branson, wanted something inexpensive that would allow our 2 dogs. Read reviews on this little motel. Found coupon on TravelBuddy. Got a 1st floor double queen, which had plenty of room for us and the dogs, fridge, coffee pot and coffee, plus decent linens and mattress. Keep in mind, you cannot remove dog urine spots no matter what you use, so don't freak out if you see spots in the carpet, you do not smell anything. Room was very, very clean. Breakfast offered, coffee, milk, couple of cereal choices, little bowls of gravy, plain and raisin bagels, biscuits, toaster waffles and french toast and cinnamon rolls, You toast or microwave everything, but when we went down, there was no one else in the area, so waiting was no problem. I can see if ,it was crowded where it might be an issue, especially, if you were trying to deal with children.. But felt they offered decent selection especially since our room was only 50.00, Plus, they had a decent pancake sryup not the cheap runny kind.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, only had one problem, whoever had the room above as flooded their bathroom, so it dripped downed to our room. The stuff was quick to get us another room. They were very friendly & apologetic. The location was great. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Justice1Independence
Reviews.Content: Went to Kenneth Copeland"s convention in Branson, Mo last weekend and stayed at Scenic Hills Inn. The motel was very clean and the owners were very nice. Very good selection for breakfast. Our group of 10 men turned out to be only three as some received jobs and other obligations prevented some from coming. We had reserved more rooms than we needed but the owners worked with us and made it a very enjoyable experience! I will most definitely stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff/comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: ARtraveler63
Reviews.Content: Our group of sixteen was efficiently checked in to this conveniently located property. Hotel arrangement is a little confusing as the lobby is on the third floor. Elevators are located just off the lobby. Beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Breakfast included usual offerings, and cinnamon rolls were available on some days. Breakfast attendant was welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price.”
Reviews.Author: 4Leisuretravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within close driving distance of all major attractions in Branson. The hotel is not fancy but serves it purpose with a fair price. It has a small but nice outdoor pool. The complimentary breakfast could have more selection with healthier choices but serves the purpose of getting the day strarted.

Reviews.Title: “OMG....what a nightmare. Well if we got sleep it would be nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: heyitsme99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this nightmare that had no window covering except a thin curtain. We were awakened at 7am each morning with the sun beaming in our face. We had a bad TV for three days. We took several pictures of the curtain issue that wasn't a concern of the hotel management. We called management several times about the issue while there and called several times after we left the nightmare. The only response we received at home was a threating call from the hotel to a law suit for us making " racial slur" on this feedback blog. WOW now that's a business, your customer is very dissatisfied with your service or product and instead of resolving any issues you threaten them with a law suit. Our time in Branson was great however because of the hotel and management we would never return unless we brought our own privacy curtains, TV and attorney of which we now have retained to follow up with the hotel's threat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Wandering57
Reviews.Content: Great little family-run hotel for the price. Breakfast was decent, although the breakfast room and the corridors were a little stuffy (it was very hot outside). Nice sheets and towels. Only used the pool once but it was adequate. My only 'complaint' (and it's minor) is that we were on 2nd floor, and the soundproofing was not that good. So although we couldn't hear televisions or talking in other rooms, we could hear people walking back and forth on their floor in the room above us, as well as the showers running in other rooms. Again, just a minor inconvenience. Overall, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SarahI937
Reviews.Content: We arrived saturday afternoon on 4th of July weekend with no hotel reservations. We were on a last minute romantic getaway and asked for a room for 2. The desk staff were very friendly and apologetic. They actually offered us the honeymoon suite for regular room price. Once in the room, we loved it. The decor was beautiful and the room was clean. The hotel was quiet and a nice place to just relax. The bed was also very comfortable. It was also fairly close to all that Branson has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and affordable”
Reviews.Author: garydra
Reviews.Content: Excellent motel. Front desk personnel were very friendly. Rooms were clean, all non smoking rooms. Bed was very comfortable with ac working great. Nice 32" HD TV. Nice swimming pool area. Good breakfast with freshly made rolls every morning. Would like to see a waffle iron to make waffles with. That is minor, however. Conveniently located to Branson attractions. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kelogan
Reviews.Content: We love Scenic Hills Inn. We stayed there 2 or 3 times a year for the last 5 years (last time April 2011). I just cant say enough about this hotel. The owners and staff are awesome. They go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. They greet you in the mornings with a smile and breakfast (the cinnamon rolls are so good). The hotel and the rooms are very clean. I would recommend and do recommend this place to everybody. Its the number one place to stay in Branson (voted by Lenny and Kelly Ogan)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE--STAYED THERE EVERY BRANSON VISIT”
Reviews.Author: lizzard52
Reviews.Content: Nina and deb are great-- makes you feel at home- goes out of the way to please you-- have stayed with them for years--Ellen and donna illinois sisters- will be back with them soon thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--nice, clean and welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: guthriewoman
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by a friendly and helpful woman. Our room was clean and appeared to have new linens. It had a nice flat-screen t.v. with all of the usual channels. There were numerous pamplets with information on all of the area attractions as well as several discount coupons. Instructions on where to go in case of severe weather was included in the helpful room pamplet. The breakfast was hot and there was plenty to eat. The hotel was easy to find and easy to access (it was on a main road.) It had all of the necessities you would expect -- a refrigerator, coffe pot (with coffee, creamer and suger), hairdryer, iron and ironing board. It was supplied with soap and shampoo/conditioner. Easy access to ice and vending machines was availble on two floors. There was plenty of parking. Although the hot water wasn't as hot as we would like there was plenty of it. We would highly recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Convenient, Clean & A Great Deal !!!!”
Reviews.Author: BransonVisitor11
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The room (king leisure) was clean, roomy, quiet and had a microwave and refridgerator. We received a great deal on entertainment and room rate, 4 shows, 4 nights, and 5 days. We felt the location was great, easy access to everything. Overall, we had a wonderful experience. Thank you Nina and Staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: dlkelleytn
Reviews.Content: Motel was clean, staff was friendly, rates very affordable, and the cinamon rolls were really good. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic Hills Inn is located in a great place”
Reviews.Author: dot97
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this place for the price and friendliness. It seemed to be very clean. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were a little small for more than two people, but they worked out okay. I liked its location, which was close to everything we wanted to do. It was easy to get to and not so much traffic. The continental breakfast was very good. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Glad in find a good clean place.”
Reviews.Author: mjhill6
Reviews.Content: Trip was a last minute thing and was very concerned that we would not get a clean place. I was plesurely surprized. The beds should be replaced but it was clean. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Expanded Breakfast was dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: midmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Scenic Hills in Branson for 1 week. The breakfast area was overcrowded and very unorganized. If one person was toasting what they call waffles it held up the whole room. I was also chewed out by a maid for putting ice in a quart baggie. I found this to be a very disapointing Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mande31
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times since the motel opened. I keep coming back because of the friendly and courteous personnel, the clean and quiet rooms never had any problem. The continental breakfast is serving next to the lobby and my family love there cinnamon rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: nadave
Reviews.Content: THE worst place I have ever stayed at in my 44 years of life. I have traveld a good deal bein I have been in the Miltary for over 21 years and this place is the worst. we found grass in our bed between the sheets. and when I went to complane the office was closed. I couldn't even get an extra pillow. the rooms are VERY small with no more in the but two cups for your water and a pitcher for your ice. and of course the unconfortable bed. the bath room shower is hard to get going and the water is luke warm. I have been in the filed with such acomadations. which is not bad if your camping. So if you want to go camping in Branson go here. But you should not have to bring bug spray.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: MaunaKea12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip and this location was dirty, smelly and the one staff member who we saw at the front desk, maintenance worker and our maid was somewhat rude. She was not very friendly and seemed snappy at times. We were located in the back of the motel and the view was of a parking lot, trash bin and a propane tank. The window sill wall paper was wet and the room smelled of dog(s). I would not recommend this location even if it was FREE!!! Branson was great and there are a number of other motel that would be a much better pick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off the Beaten Path to Stay with your Pet”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinDuckies
Reviews.Content: Our small terrier travels with us, and Scenic Hills is a blessing in disguise to travelers with small pets. We chose it because it's away from the strip area, it's not noisy, and if your pet is well behaved, crated or not, you can leave it for more than a few hours so you can go out and do things. The rooms on the 1st floor in the back are specifically for the travelers with pets. The rooms are clean, and they do not stink of pets at all. It's amazing. Wooded area across the parking lot for those doggie moments. You can also take your dog for a great walk on the trails at Table Rock only a few miles away. Management understands that there are a lot of people who want their pets to be welcome. The service and staff is great and very helpful in answering questions on where to go and what to see. We were able to enjoy our vacation knowing that our dog was safe in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic view thats a laugh”
Reviews.Author: grayrolls
Reviews.Content: We travel to Branson at least 3 times a year and thought we would give this motel a try BAD IDEA. The room was on the lower level in the rear. The scenic view we had was of the parking lot, propane tank and trash bin. The room wasn't clean wet carpet and a hole in the wall. I wouldn't stay there again if it were FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and comfortable, friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dbleagle
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at just how nice Scenic Hills Inn was. The room was very clean, the staff was so friendly, they went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, we got great seats to the shows from them. We loved the quiet location, since it wasn't right on the strip we were able to avoid alot of the traffic getting around to the restaurants, shows, shopping, etc., but was still close to everything. The pool is not the largest, but is very nice and clean. We will stay here again on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate in cleanliness and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KansasSunflower
Reviews.Content: This hotel has immaculately clean rooms. Friendly staff and good location. Also very quiet and has the best cinnamon rolls for breakfast ever. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: mkejme96
Reviews.Content: We came upon this hotel after having a horrible experience at the Southern Oaks Inn, We stopped by there the night before our stay and secured our room. We asked for a room key so we could see the rooms before booking it, and the desk clerk, didn't have a problem with that! We checked in early the next day, and our room was very clean, and was in great shape. The bathroom is very small, but it was managable. We used the pool and hot tub very late one night, and had a great porch swing to set on and watch the traffic. When I asked for a cup of coffee at 10:30 pm the desk clerk gladly made a fresh pot for me! The breakfast was nice, with lots of selections! This is our new favorite hotel in Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with our doggies!”
Reviews.Author: Okra876
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend with our two Rat Terriers. The place is clean, very pet friendly, nice staff, and decent breakfast. We left our dogs in the room crated when we went to dinner or were shopping and never had a problem. It is not on the main strip so if that's where you want to be, you won't be happy here. We enjoy staying a little bit away from all of the crowds and traffic, so it was fine for us. It is still quite convenient to everything, but you will have to drive. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone that has physical limitations as it is built on a hill (hence the name), however this was not an issue for us. Pool looked very clean and inviting, but it rained all weekend so we did not get to enjoy it :( Overall we had a really fun time and a good stay at the Scenic Hills Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: IowaTravelingtrio
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent one week at Scenic Hills and loved it! I really liked how clean it all was. The pool was closed when we were there, but we were regulars in the hot tub! We'll be back on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Our place in Branson”
Reviews.Author: princess244
Reviews.Content: It was our first time everything was great. I will stay here again, no doubt. Their staff was friendly and the rooms were extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “it was average”
Reviews.Author: booklover2
Reviews.Content: we stayed in june of 2006 for 2 nights. We had a coupon for 38 dollars for 3 of us, our son stayed free, since he was under 16. We did not use the pool, since we were doing amusement and water parks. It was a little more away from hwy 76 than we wanted, but we figured we would do it for 2 nights. We ate the breakfast, nothing exciting bagels, cereal, canned fruit, and cinnamon rolls which were not that great. We had no problem with the room or the staff. They had a washer and dryer, so that came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: cubancoffeefan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Scenic hills Inn in July, We felt they we very unprofessional because first thing that happened cleaning women did not wear any shoes and was going from room to room with no shoes on just barefeet with cut off shorts. We tried to talk with hotel regarding this matter they got very defensive and in a sarcastic tone said well was your room clean!!!! Then employees had there own children running the pool area like it was there home. The last thing that was very upsetting was we checked out a day early and about a 8 days later we received a bill in the mail saying that they had charged our credit card $60.00 for 3 missing towels. When I called to tell them we did not have towels and never used there towels because we brought our own they did not care they still charged us. They had no proof. Just watch out for this because they could do this to any guest once you are home you can not even defend yourself. They could make alot of money on your account. I have been going to branson for over 35 years and travel alot through out the year I use many different hotels and have never encountered anything quite like this.

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are in good shape, this is a fairly good place to stay. You will have to walk uphill to your vehicle unless you use the handicapped spaces or stairs. We stayed there 3 nights and I will never book a room there again. There are 4 floors and we were on the 3rd floor, which is ground level. Does that tell you what the parking is like? Upon entering our room, it was VERY warm, so my husband tried to turn on the air conditioner. We had to go back to the lobby to get the desk clerk to turn on the power. I feel the room should have been ready...even cool! I am a person who brings along Lysol spray to disinfect the bathroom areas. I actually had to rinse long black hair out of the shower walls. I don't think the sheets had been changed on the first bed I checked, so we slept in the other one. Thank God there was a GFCI because when I plugged in my hairdryer the next morning, I got shocked. The first day we left while our room was being cleaned at 3 o'clock in the afternoon. That housekeeper was obviously overworked but she cleaned our room very well and even changed the sheets where we slept. The next day, however, we stayed in the room and an older lady did not even leave us all the linens to replace those she picked up. She did not clean ANYTHING. She only replaced pillowcases (after I asked her to) and bath towels, emptied the trash and left. I have never visited a hotel or motel that is CLOSED from 11 pm to 7 am. The lobby was actually LOCKED! We were ready to check out early because the Shepherd of the Hills Expressway was to be closed due to the Veterans parade. There is no other way out of this area and we had to wait until 7 am. Also, they advertise EXTENDED breakfast.......it was awful! I only saw decaf and reg coffee, juice, a bowl of fruit, cereal, bagels and sweet rolls that were obviously from a package. There was a sign that I ignored asking that food not be taken to the room. The rolls were a SNACK for that night. We ate breakfast at Golden Corral. There was also a sign that asked you to not fill your ice chest with ice from the ice machine which I ignored. The second night there was a lot of noise upstairs until very late. There is no place to complain. Remember the lobby is closed. I observed handicapped guests leaving the next morning which explained the noise and why there was a knock on our door even though the "do not disturb" sign was posted. Also when my husband got indigestion, I found AlkaSeltzer in their gift shop. Two AlkaSeltzer in a packet cost a dollar! These things did not ruin our vacation but there are so many motels in Branson better than this one. . . . . probably cheaper, too!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow!! What an unexpected pleasure. Normally we are hesitant about staying in a place that doesn't have a familiar name. But we found an unbelievable low priced coupon for the Scenic Hills Inn and decided to try it. From the first view of the lobby and through our room inspection, we knew it was a well cared for facility and had the extra touches that make a weary traveler happy. The decor provides a unique and welcoming appearance, right down to the fancy folded towels and hallway floral arrangements. The staff was friendly and eager to please. In addition, there was internet access which we needed. Even though we only stayed one night, we were thankful to have a comfortable place to rest.

HotelInfo.Name: Scenic Hills Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2422 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
